summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case, specifically changing the location of a hearing on her motion for a new trial to Courtroom 110 at the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse and detailing COVID-19 entry protocols for attendees.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case for whom a hearing on a motion for a new trial is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the order, presiding over the case and setting the hearing details and COVID-19 protocols.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the legal proceedings involving defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Hearing on Maxwell's Motion for New Trial
events.description: A court hearing scheduled to address Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial.

locations: Courtroom 110, Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Centre Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial was scheduled for March 8, 2022, at 10:00 a.m.
The hearing location was changed to Courtroom 110 of the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse at 40 Centre Street, New York, NY.
The court order was signed by Judge Alison J. Nathan on March 3, 2022.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire and mandatory N95, KN95, or KF94 masks.
The document references Docket Number 610 as the prior order scheduling the hearing.
